articles.description: Aerosols — tiny airborne particles such as sea salt, smoke, dust, and pollutants — play a critical role in shaping our planet's climate. They scatter and absorb sunlight, influencing how much solar energy reaches the Earth's surface.
articles.content:
Nasa's Plankton, Aerosol, Cloud, ocean Ecosystem (PACE) mission is poised to revolutionise our understanding of Earth's atmosphere and oceans.
